climbs.name: Weili Zhang
climbs.fa: Mike Robinson, Stu Salinas, Rudy VanVorhees

content.description: Depending on your size, the crux is at the start or a little bit after. Climb wide hands to a shallow slot and to the top of this crack.
content.location:
This is a short line that is just left of

Ken Shamrock

.

content.description: Climb half face, half crack moves at the start. Work into a pod, and jam your way out on wide fists. Continue up on wide hands/tight OW and past a chunk of mudstone. Finish as you started on half crack, half face moves into a mantel for the final move.
content.protection: #3 to #6, #3.5 and #4.5 are helpful if you have (if not you'll want 2x #3s and #4s).
content.location:
This is the other side of the flake that forms

Weili Zhang

on the DCB Tower facing the trail.

content.description:
This is a variation start to

Anderson...Silva

. I went back today to climb this route and couldn't figure out how I scrambled up the face of this boulder on the FA. So, instead of free soling the outside of the boulder, I climbed the squeeze chimney on the right. Squeeze your way up, and mantel the boulder before entering the P1 chimney of

Anderson...Silva

.
content.location:
This is deep into the canyon on the East Side.  It is on the right side of the large boulder at the base of

Anderson...Silva

.

content.description: Start on a splitter OW to a fist-sized roof. Continue up into a flaring squeeze with a finger crack inside.
content.location:
It is just right of

Chuck Liddel

. As with

Chuck Liddel

, continue up, and hike out through the cave.

content.description: The hardest but also most obvious moves are at the start. Climb fingers to hands to a ledge, belay here, or continue another 50 feet to top of climb. The second half climbs a lower angle, flaring crack on mostly secure moves.
content.protection: 2x #0.4 to #3. you need a 70m to get off this too
content.location:
This route is the first line on the UFC Wall. It separates COVID Castle from UFC with

Social D Chimney

being just to the left of this line.

content.description: Climb wide fists to OW into the pod, and continue up to the top.
content.location: This is on the right side of D. C. B. Tower.

climbs.name: Glass Joe
climbs.fa: Stu Salinas, Mike Robinson, Rudy Van Vorhees

content.description:
This is the fastest, shortest way to top out The DCB Tower.

Peanut Butter Falcon

,

Chuck Liddel

, and the descent squeeze tunnel will get you to the start of this short pitch. It tops out a detached tower/buttress (The DCB Tower). This tower also has

Chuck Liddel

, Testostikleeze , and

Weili Zhang

routes on it.
content.location:
Start at

Chuck Liddel

, and scramble up right and into a narrow corridor to the right. Continue up and through a small hole and into the descent passage for

Peanut Butter Falcon

and

Ken Shamrock

. Continue left and out of the corridor, and you'll be at the base of this short route which tops out the DCB Tower.

content.description: P1 starts on thin hands and moves into 0.4/0.5 size fingers. Finish with fist jam and OW moves to gain the ledge.
content.protection: 4x 0.4 and singles from 0.75 to 4. Rap from a slung chockstone.
content.location: This is 70 feet right of The Coner McGregor Tower.

climbs.name: Conor McGregor
climbs.fa: Mike Robinson, Rudy Van Vorhees, Hayden Marlowe

content.description: This is one of my favorite pitches out here! Find the corridor between the UFC Wall and The Conor McGregor Tower. Walk inside, and send the furthest crack in. Climb a variety of jams, stems, and body scumming up this pitch. Get to the logical conclusion of this line, then turn around, and top out the Conor McGregor Tower as a bonus...downclimb back to a slung chockstone, and lower.
content.protection: A singles BD rack from #0.4 to #4.
content.location: This is located just next to the DCB Tower near the middle of the UFC Wall.  Find the corridor between the UFC Wall and The Conor McGregor Tower, walk inside, and send the furthest crack in.

climbs.name: Chuck Liddel
climbs.fa: D. C. B. (FFA Mike Robinson/Benji Perry 10/20)

content.description: This whole thing is kind of strange and cruxy. The start is most difficult as the route angles off, and if you're the right size, it is easy to squeeze up to the top.
content.protection: Cams #7 to #4. There is a deep chockstone that makes this line lead only, walk out only, rope will get stuck if you rap and try to pull
content.location:
This is the obvious, flaring OW/chimney just right of

Christos Anesti

.

content.description: Start by stemming, then move into finger and hand jams to the top.
content.location:
It is just right of

Kimbo Slice

.

climbs.name: Anderson "The Spider" Silva
climbs.fa: Mike Robinson, Mary Anderson, 12/21 (1st 90 feet: MR/RV, 1/21)

content.description:
There are 2 ways to start this: one is by scrambling your way 30 feet on a boulder with no gear (5.7ish). The other is to climb the chimney on the right side of the same boulder. At the top of the boulder, enter the chimney, and stem your way up another 50 feet. The climbing is on great rock, but the placements are on bad rock. The moves are secure. Above the chimney, the crack closes to fists then quickly becomes OW/squeeze for the next 60 feet.

P2 has not been yet done. It looks to be a wide chimney that continues for another 80 feet.
content.protection: P1: 2X full rack up to #6 and a #7 & #8
content.location:
This is the climber's rightmost route on the UFC Wall. It starts on the large boulder 30 feet to the right on "

Mighty Mouse

".

content.description: Man, this thing is good! It does not climb like it looks either. Use a full variety of moves, on a full variety of sizes, then work out the corner, and pull around the roof. (This was climbed fully free on TR, the hardest moves are 5.12- and well-protected with gear.)
content.location:
This is just right of the Spider Boulder at the base of

Anderson Silva

.
